clinical_study.brief_title: Study on the Value of Non-invasive Dual-Pet Information in Subtype of Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Single-center STudy on the vAlue of Non-invasive Dual-Pet（18F-FES PET and 68Ga-HER2-Affibody PET）InformatiOn IN Subtype of Metastatic Breast Cancer(MBC)

brief_summary.textblock: Study on the Value of Non-invasive Dual-Pet(18F-FES PET and 68Ga-HER2-Affibody PET) Information in Subtype of Metastatic Breast Cancer

detailed_description.textblock: A Phase II, Single-center STudy on the vAlue of Non-invasive Dual-Pet（18F-FES PET and 68Ga-HER2-Affibody PET）InformatiOn IN Subtype of Metastatic Breast Cancer(MBC)

primary_outcome.measure: Verify the subtype value of dual-PET in extrahepatic metastases
primary_outcome.description: Verify whether the subtype value of FES-PET and HER2-PET is consistent with biopsy or surgical pathology in extrahepatic metastases.

secondary_outcome.measure: Verify the HER2-PET value in liver metastasis
secondary_outcome.description: Verify whether the HER2-PET value is consistent with biopsy or surgical pathology in liver metastasis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Verify the HER2-PET value in brain metastasis
secondary_outcome.description: Verify whether the HER2-PET value is consistent with biopsy or surgical pathology in brian metastasis.
Observe the heterogeneity of ER and HER2 expression in metastatic lesions.

intervention.intervention_name: biopsy or surgical pathology in metastases
intervention.description: biopsy or surgical pathology in extrahepatic/liver/brain metastases
68Ga-NOTA-MAL-MZHER2 (68Ga-HER2) affibody is an investigational Positron Emission Tomography (PET)/ Computed Tomography (CT) radiopharmaceutical.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects voluntarily joined the study, signed informed consent, and had good compliance.
2. Female patients aged over 18 years (including cutoff value).
3. an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0 to 2.
4. Recurrence or metastatic breast cancer confirmed by histopathology, or expect to be feasible metastasis puncture or surgery to confirm histopathological recurrence or metastatic breast cancer.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnancy or lactation.
2. Alcohol allergy is not suitable for FES-PET/ C.
3. There are contraindications for patients who are expected to have metastasis puncture or surgery.
4. Mental disorders or other conditions affecting patient compliance.

facility.name: Shanghai Cancer Center Institutional Review Board

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of department of medical oncology
